intro: Espeletia petiolata var. escobensis, commonly known as the Escobes giant heather, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, dense rosettes of silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flower heads that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of the páramo ecosystem. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
